<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/google-set-offer-checking-account?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Don’t Talk to Google if You’re Not Talking Cache
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="google atm " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNjgxNDkxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know that feeling when you’re booted from the group chat? Then you miss Thursday night trivia? And the next thing you know everyone else’s revenue is diversified except for yours?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That’s Google’s biggest fear. </strong>So it’s planning to start offering checking accounts through Google Pay as soon as next year, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/next-in-googles-quest-for-consumer-dominancebanking-11573644601#comments_sector?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>. The project, nicknamed “Cache,” will arrive as a partnership with Citigroup and a Stanford University credit union.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Loyal Brew readers know <a href="https://www.engadget.com/2019/11/13/google-checking-accounts-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">every tech giant</a> and even the fake ones (Uber) are getting into financial services to add some spice to their revenue streams.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How Cache is familiar</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The D word...data concerns. Checking accounts are full of valuable info like where you shop and what you earn. But Google <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/13/20962745/google-checking-account-citigroup-stanford-pay-banking-financial-services-cache?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">promised</a> <em>not</em> to sell account holders’ financial data.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So why bother if you can’t peddle data to advertisers?</strong> “If we can help more people do more stuff in a digital way online, it’s good for the internet and good for us,” exec Caesar Sengupta told the WSJ after spending all day on <span class="_19bCWnxeTjqzBElWZfIlJb">r/explainlikeimfive.</span></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How Cache is different</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google wants to “partner deeply with banks and the financial system.” The banks will handle the boring stuff like regulatory compliance, but they’ll get to slap their brands on the checking accounts—an opportunity many of Google's peers aren't extending to their financial partners.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Apple recently launched a credit card “designed by Apple, not a bank”...with Goldman Sachs, the </span><span><a href="https://www.bankrate.com/banking/biggest-banks-in-america/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5th largest</a></span><span> U.S. bank by assets.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Facebook </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-facebook-pay/facebook-unites-payment-service-across-apps-with-facebook-pay-idUSKBN1XM2BW?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a></span><span> Facebook Pay on Tuesday, shortly after most major financial companies dropped out of its Libra crypto project.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Despite D.C. regulators’ <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/11/13/google-eyes-banking-it-widens-its-reach/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heavy breathing</a> and general public mistrust, Google & Co. are going full-steam ahead into financial services. One advantage Google might have—58% of consumers would trust Google financial products, <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/sergeiklebnikov/2019/11/13/google-reportedly-plans-to-offer-checking-accounts-next-year/#6c8c98626def?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per McKinsey</a>. 56% would trust Apple and only 35% would trust Facebook.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/venice-mayor-blames-flooding-climate-change?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Flooded by Water, Flooded by Oil
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="flooding in venice " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNjc5Mzg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Simone Padovani/Awakening/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tuesday night, Venice, Italy, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/13/world/europe/venice-flood.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was inundated</a> by its highest tide in 50 years. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Piazzas, streets, and monuments like St. Mark’s Basilica were flooded with as much as three feet of water. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mayor Luigi Brugnaro <a href="https://twitter.com/LuigiBrugnaro/status/1194371080170983424?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said that</a> Venice was “on its knees” and climate change was to blame. Speaking of which…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The International Energy Agency (IEA) <a href="https://apnews.com/5942f5ef2c1540b48a77f4e6029e762d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> its much-anticipated industry forecast yesterday. The intergovernmental organization predicts that <span>oil demand will increase until the 2030s while carbon emissions will climb until at least 2040</span>, mostly due to…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Anticipated population growth in Africa and Asia </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Omnipresent gas-guzzling SUVs </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Growing demand for plastic and air travel </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On the bright side, </strong>the Tom Hanks Mister Rogers movie <span>will be out in a week</span>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-COMMERCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/nike-will-stop-selling-directly-amazon?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For Nike and Amazon, This Can Only Mean One Thing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We always pegged Nike’s c-suite as Pusha T fans, but they’re not above taking a page from Drake—walking <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/arts-entertainment/2019/11/11/drake-was-booed-music-festival-because-hes-drake/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offstage</a> mid-set.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nike will <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-13/nike-will-end-its-pilot-project-selling-products-on-amazon-site?srnd=markets-vp&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no longer sell</a> sneakers and apparel directly on Amazon, ending a two-year pilot program during which Amazon bought <a href="https://www.engadget.com/2019/11/13/nike-ending-retail-pilot-amazon/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">straight from Nike</a> instead of third-party vendors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Brands the size of Nike have said Amazon doesn’t work hard enough to wipe out its flourishing community of <a href="https://qz.com/1747795/why-nike-will-stop-selling-on-amazon/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">counterfeit sellers</a>. That and Amazon’s strict price control can devalue outside brands’ products.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nike is focused on higher-margin “direct, personal relationships” with your feet. Amazon, the country’s largest internet retailer, doesn’t exactly offer that.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nike did business with 30,000 retailers in 2017. In the future, it'll limit itself to about 40 partners.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While roughly 68% of Nike’s annual sales comes from wholesale, that share is shrinking. Nike’s direct business has grown 3x as fast as overall revenue since 2013.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Keep in mind:</strong> Nike recently hired ex-eBay exec John Donahoe as its next CEO. He’s expected to <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90430332/nike-tried-playing-nice-with-amazon-heres-why-it-didnt-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overhaul</a> Nike’s marketing and retail strategies.</p>

</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/hong-kong-protests-spill-universities?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hong Kong Protests Spill Into Universities
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="university in hong kong" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTUwL3VuaXZlcnNpdHlfaW5faG9uZ19rb25nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the past week, the protests in Hong Kong <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-hong-kong-universities-become-battle-zones-mainland-chinese-students-flee-11573649430?mod=hp_lead_pos7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crossed a Rubicon</a> when violence erupted at the territory’s universities, which previously had avoided the turmoil. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A student at </span><span><span>the </span></span><span>Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, Alex Chow, </span><span><a href="https://time.com/5722028/hong-kong-student-death/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">died</a></span><span> on Friday. </span><span><span>He is believed to be the first person to die as a result of injuries sustained during demonstrations</span></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Police </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c54b2c36-05aa-11ea-a984-fbbacad9e7dd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">occupied a bridge</a></span><span> near </span><span><span>the </span></span><span>Chinese University of Hong Kong while protesting students barricaded themselves inside. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That puts Hong Kong business schools in a tough spot. </strong>This is the season <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/b1fcd664-df9b-11e9-b8e0-026e07cbe5b4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">they normally start</a> marketing for the fall 2020 class. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><span>China is the biggest source of non-local students at HK universities</span></span><span>, but the protests may discourage potential applicants. One doctoral student in HK told the WSJ he’s avoiding speaking Mandarin because of the tensions. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Plus, the protests </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/31/hong-kong-officially-recession?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have driven</a></span><span> Hong Kong’s economy into a recession, which could mean fewer job prospects for newly minted MBAs. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All this could lead to Hong Kong losing ground to rival Singapore in recruiting business school students. Hong Kong has one major advantage, though: proximity to mainland China.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why Is Streaming So Cheap?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="the streaming wars " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNjgzOTk4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>It’s Day 3 of our teardown of the streaming industry to mark the launch of Disney+. If you missed them, here are </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>part 1</em></a><em> and </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/4-minute-history-disney?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>part 2</em></a><em>. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">People are cord-cutting faster than anticipated. But they’re not curling up with leatherbound books—not when streaming services offer incredible video content for just $5–$15 a month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It all makes you wonder...with companies pouring in billions to develop original shows and acquire classics, how do they make money on streaming? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Short answer:</strong> New platforms will need several years to pay for themselves. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Long answer</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Netflix</strong> has done some theatrical releases, but it’s the closest to a pure-play major streaming company that exists. For the others, streaming is meant to support and amplify the broader business. Friend of the Brew and streaming wizard Matt Ball <a href="https://www.matthewball.vc/all/minedmedia?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explains</a>...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">AT&T’s HBO Max </strong></span><span>can boost its wireless business and digital services (live TV, Showtime).</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Amazon Prime Video </strong></span><span>is free for Prime members. And the more Prime members, the more that’s spent on Amazon’s e-commerce platform.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Apple TV+ </strong></span><span>is part of Apple’s pivot to services. It can also be pushed across billions of Apple devices. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">NBCUniversal’s Peacock...</strong></span><span>who knows. But it'll have </span><span><em>The Office.</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Disney+ </strong></span><span>offers a direct line to viewers, whose data Disney can use to inform merchandising, marketing, and experiences. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Disney+ passed <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-walt-disney-streaming/disney-streaming-service-reaches-10-million-sign-ups-shares-surge-idUSKBN1XN2AK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10 million</a> signups yesterday, but the #StreamingWars aren’t just about headcount. What matters is how much time users spend on each platform. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Want to go deeper? </strong><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/streaming-subscription-costs-dollarsheres?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Keep reading</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BOOK REC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/bina-venkataraman-thinks-better?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bina Venkataraman Thinks You Could Be Doing Better
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Photo of Bina Venkataraman" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNjc0MjA1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Bina Venkataraman</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No one's counting, but it's now been 62 days of sleeping in instead of going for a jog. Having a short-term vision means instant gratification, but we often end up losing in the long run—as individuals, businesses, even societies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So...what can you do?</strong> First, check out Bina Venkataraman's new book, <a href="http://writerbina.com/the-optimists-telescope?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Optimist's Telescope</em></a>. As a former s<span>enior advisor for climate change innovation</span> to the White House, she's got experience trying to get Fortune 500 companies to invest in a 20-year promise over quarterly gains. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Venkataraman sat down for the Brew's Pumpkin Spice Author Series to discuss some lessons from her book and career, including: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why we have trouble imagining and planning for the future </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How the Business Roundtable is shaking things up</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The power of today's youth  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/13/interview-optimists-telescope-author-bina-venkataraman?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out here</a>.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F13%2Fbina-venkataraman-thinks-better" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNjgxNDkxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou know that feeling when you’re booted from the group chat? Then you miss Thursday night trivia? And the next thing you know everyone else’s revenue is diversified except for yours?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat’s Google’s biggest fear. \u003c/strong\u003eSo it’s planning to start offering checking accounts through Google Pay as soon as next year, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/next-in-googles-quest-for-consumer-dominancebanking-11573644601#comments_sector?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. The project, nicknamed “Cache,” will arrive as a partnership with Citigroup and a Stanford University credit union.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLoyal Brew readers know \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/2019/11/13/google-checking-accounts-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eevery tech giant\u003c/a\u003e and even the fake ones (Uber) are getting into financial services to add some spice to their revenue streams.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow Cache is familiar\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe D word...data concerns. Checking accounts are full of valuable info like where you shop and what you earn. But Google \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/13/20962745/google-checking-account-citigroup-stanford-pay-banking-financial-services-cache?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epromised\u003c/a\u003e \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e to sell account holders’ financial data.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo why bother if you can’t peddle data to advertisers?\u003c/strong\u003e “If we can help more people do more stuff in a digital way online, it’s good for the internet and good for us,” exec Caesar Sengupta told the WSJ after spending all day on \u003cspan class=\"_19bCWnxeTjqzBElWZfIlJb\"\u003er/explainlikeimfive.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow Cache is different\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoogle wants to “partner deeply with banks and the financial system.” The banks will handle the boring stuff like regulatory compliance, but they’ll get to slap their brands on the checking accounts—an opportunity many of Google's peers aren't extending to their financial partners.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eApple recently launched a credit card “designed by Apple, not a bank”...with Goldman Sachs, the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bankrate.com/banking/biggest-banks-in-america/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e5th largest\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e U.S. bank by assets.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFacebook \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-facebook-pay/facebook-unites-payment-service-across-apps-with-facebook-pay-idUSKBN1XM2BW?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunveiled\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Facebook Pay on Tuesday, shortly after most major financial companies dropped out of its Libra crypto project.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite D.C. regulators’ \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/11/13/google-eyes-banking-it-widens-its-reach/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheavy breathing\u003c/a\u003e and general public mistrust, Google \u0026 Co. are going full-steam ahead into financial services. One advantage Google might have—58% of consumers would trust Google financial products, \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/sergeiklebnikov/2019/11/13/google-reportedly-plans-to-offer-checking-accounts-next-year/#6c8c98626def?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper McKinsey\u003c/a\u003e. 56% would trust Apple and only 35% would trust style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe always pegged Nike’s c-suite as Pusha T fans, but they’re not above taking a page from Drake—walking \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/arts-entertainment/2019/11/11/drake-was-booed-music-festival-because-hes-drake/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoffstage\u003c/a\u003e mid-set.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNike will \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-13/nike-will-end-its-pilot-project-selling-products-on-amazon-site?srnd=markets-vp\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eno longer sell\u003c/a\u003e sneakers and apparel directly on Amazon, ending a two-year pilot program during which Amazon bought \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/2019/11/13/nike-ending-retail-pilot-amazon/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estraight from Nike\u003c/a\u003e instead of third-party vendors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eBrands the size of Nike have said Amazon doesn’t work hard enough to wipe out its flourishing community of \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1747795/why-nike-will-stop-selling-on-amazon/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecounterfeit sellers\u003c/a\u003e. That and Amazon’s strict price control can devalue outside brands’ products.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNike is focused on higher-margin “direct, personal relationships” with your feet. Amazon, the country’s largest internet retailer, doesn’t exactly offer that.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNike did business with 30,000 retailers in 2017. In the future, it'll limit itself to about 40 partners.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile roughly 68% of Nike’s annual sales comes from wholesale, that share is shrinking. Nike’s direct business has grown 3x as fast as overall revenue since 2013.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKeep in mind:\u003c/strong\u003e Nike recently hired ex-eBay exec John Donahoe as its next CEO. He’s expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90430332/nike-tried-playing-nice-with-amazon-heres-why-it-didnt-work?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoverhaul\u003c/a\u003e Nike’s marketing and retail strategies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS student at \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHong Kong University of Science and Technology, Alex Chow, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://time.com/5722028/hong-kong-student-death/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edied\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Friday. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe is believed to be the first person to die as a result of injuries sustained during demonstrations\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePolice \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/c54b2c36-05aa-11ea-a984-fbbacad9e7dd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoccupied a bridge\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e near \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChinese University of Hong Kong while protesting students barricaded themselves inside. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat puts Hong Kong business schools in a tough spot. \u003c/strong\u003eThis is the season \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/b1fcd664-df9b-11e9-b8e0-026e07cbe5b4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethey normally start\u003c/a\u003e marketing for the fall 2020 style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChina is the biggest source of non-local students at HK universities\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, but the protests may discourage potential applicants. One doctoral student in HK told the WSJ he’s avoiding speaking Mandarin because of the tensions. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePlus, the protests \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/31/hong-kong-officially-recession?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave driven\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Hong Kong’s economy into a recession, which could mean fewer job prospects for newly minted MBAs. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAll this could lead to Hong Kong losing ground to rival Singapore in recruiting business school students. But they’re not curling up with leatherbound books—not when streaming services offer incredible video content for just $5–$15 a month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt all makes you wonder...with companies pouring in billions to develop original shows and acquire classics, how do they make money on streaming? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShort answer:\u003c/strong\u003e New platforms will need several years to pay for themselves. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLong answer\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNetflix\u003c/strong\u003e has done some theatrical releases, but it’s the closest to a pure-play major streaming company that exists. For the others, streaming is meant to support and amplify the broader business. Friend of the Brew and streaming wizard Matt Ball \u003ca href=\"https://www.matthewball.vc/all/minedmedia?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplains\u003c/a\u003e...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAT\u0026T’s HBO Max \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ecan boost its wireless business and digital services (live TV, Showtime).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAmazon Prime Video \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eis free for Prime members. And the more Prime members, the more that’s spent on Amazon’s e-commerce platform.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApple TV+ \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eis part of Apple’s pivot to services. It can also be pushed across billions of Apple devices. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNBCUniversal’s Peacock...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewho knows. But it'll have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Office.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDisney+ \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eoffers a direct line to viewers, whose data Disney can use to inform merchandising, marketing, and experiences. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eDisney+ passed \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-walt-disney-streaming/disney-streaming-service-reaches-10-million-sign-ups-shares-surge-idUSKBN1XN2AK?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10 million\u003c/a\u003e signups yesterday, but the #StreamingWars aren’t just about headcount.
